forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain between 4pm and 5pm, then snow. Cloudy, with a high near 41. North wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow before 4am. Cloudy, with a low around 14. North wind 8 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 5 to 9 inches possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon creeps toward twilight in Boston, a heavy blanket of clouds envelops the skyline, darkening the day and whispering the promise of snow. At a brisk high of 41 degrees, the air feels colder, a nippy north wind adding an edge that suggests a day best enjoyed indoors. The looming specter of precipitation, with an 80% chance of rain transitioning to snow within the hour, hints at a shift that will transform the mundane cityscape into a winter wonderland by nightfall. Those venturing out should wrap themselves snugly in layers, perhaps a woolen scarf and a sturdy coat, to fend off the chill that is bound to set in as the temperature dips toward a frosty 14 degrees.

Tonight, as the clock ticks closer to four, the inevitable will unfold; snow is expected to blank the streets, with 5 to 9 inches expected to blanket the city. The gusts of wind, reaching up to 25 mph, will send chills through even the most layered of attire. It may be a fine moment to settle in with a warm drink, gazing out over the snow-covered vistas or capturing the quiet beauty of a city under white. If the call of adventure beckons, perhaps a leisurely stroll is in order, allowing the gentle snowfall to whisper secrets of winter in one’s ear. This is a time for quiet contemplation or whimsical exploration, the mundane transformed by the freshness of a snowfall, beckoning those attuned to the artistry of the ordinary to step outside into a world reshaped by nature.
